720707f-c.title: Manhattan: John Street - Pearl Street
720707f-c.text:
(1)
John Street, north side, west from Pearl (across Cliff) to Gold Streets, showing demolition in progress to provide a site for the new 26-story office building, No. 111 John Street. Also shown are (across olearance) No's. 1-9 and 11-13 Cliff Street, at, adjoining the N.W. corner of John Street. Overhead, on Pearl Street, is the South Ferry
Division of the 2nd and 3rd Avenues Elevated Lines.
June 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date.
June 10, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A limited view to Cliff Street, showing only the excavation.
June 10, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720707f-c.folder: John Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

720709f-a.title: Manhattan: John Street - Pearl Street
720709f-a.text:
(1)
John Street, south side, west from Pearl Street, showing exoavation work in progress on the north side of the street, between Pearl and Cliff Streets, where the 26-story office building, No. 111 John Street was later erected. In the foreground appears a portion of the South Ferry Division
of the 2nd and 3rd avenues Elevated Lines, on Pearl Street.
June 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a point slightly west. Prominent structure shown at the S. W. corner of Gold Street (center) is the 25-story Isurance
Centre Building, No. 60 John Street.
June 16, 1928.
P. L. sperr
(3)
A portion of the same, showing only No's. 120 to 110, at, adjoining and west of the S.W. corner of Pearl Street. At the left, is shown the excavation for the afore mentioned No. 111 John Street Building. This view is south-eastward from Cliff Street. According to the New York Times, December 9, 1937, the buildings on the left will be replaced by a new 3 story
office buildinE, No. 110.  June 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720709f-a.folder: John Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

720712f-a.title: Manhattan: John Street - Pearl Street
720712f-a.text:
(1)
119 to 103 John Street, north side, from Pearl, to and including Cliff Streets. These old tvpe houses were later demolished and on their site now (1937) stands the 26-story office building.known as No. 111 John Street. Also shown is a portion of the South Ferry division of the Second and Third Aves. Elevated Lines on Pearl Street.
January 27, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail of the same, showing only parts of No. 119-113 John Street (left), and No. 239 Pearl Street (right), both at the N.W. corner.
March 27, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720712f-a.folder: John Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

720713f-b.title: Manhattan: John Street - Pearl Street
720713f-b.text:
120 to 114 John Street, at, adjoining, and west of the S. W. corner of Pearl Street, showing also a general view of the surrounding area. At the left fore ground is seen a portion of the South Ferry Division d the
2nd and 3rd Avenuues Elevated Line on Pearl Street.
June 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A portion of the same, showing aa4ly No. 12O. Also shown are No's. 235 to 225 Pearl Street, west side, south from John to Platt Streets.
June 16, 1928.
Pc L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 1, but at a later date, showing demolition. Upon
this site was erected a 35-story office building.

722512f-a.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - John Street
722512f-a.text:
Pearl Street, west side, south from John Street, to and including Maiden LAne. The view shows the Second and Third Aves., Elevated on Pearl Street. (Pearl Street, is arbitrarily set to run north and south).
June 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
722512f-a.folder: Pearl Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY

720711f-b.title: Manhattan: John Street - Pearl Street
720711f-b.text:
l11 John Street, north side, between Pearl (richt), and Cliff (left) Streets, showing the new 26-story office building, and a general view northward as seen from No. 1 Cedar Street, adjoining the N.E. corner of Pearl Street. Also shown (foreground) is excavation work in progress on the S.W. corner of Pearl Street where a 35-story office building was later erected, bearing Nos. 118-120 John and 225-235 Pearl Streets. Note the South Ferry division of the Second and Third Aves. Elevated Line
running on Pearl Street.
July 7, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
720711f-b.folder: John Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

720711f-a.title: Manhattan: John Street - Pearl Street
720711f-a.text:
l11 John Street, north side, between Pearl (richt), and Cliff (left) Streets, showing the new 26-story office building, and a general view northward as seen from No. 1 Cedar Street, adjoining the N.E. corner of Pearl Street. 722513f-b.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - John Street
722513f-b.text:
Pearl Street, east side, at John Street, as seen through clearance on the S.W. corner of Pearl and John Streets.
July 7, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, at a later date, showing building nearing completion and obstructing the former view as seen from Fo. 75 Maiden Lane. No. 111 John Street, at the N. W. corner of Pearl Street, is shown
on the left.
November 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
722513f-b.folder: Pearl Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY

722513f-a.folder: Pearl Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY

720706f-a.title: Manhattan: John Street - Pearl Street
720706f-a.text:
Tohn Street, north side, west from but not including Pearl, to Gold Streets, showing the lower floors of the 111 John Street Building. Beyond same, between Cliff and Gold Streets, appears demolition in progress to provide a site for the 25-story Insurance Co. of North Americe Building. In the far background is visible the 14-story National Board of Underwriters
Building, at the N.W. corner of Gold Street.
May 3, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
720706f-a.folder: John Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY
